types.title: Antiphon
types.preview: A call-and-response style of liturgical or spiritual poetry, often invoking divine or cosmic themes.

types.title: Cinquain
types.preview: A five-line poetic form with a structured syllabic or word pattern, capturing a vivid image or idea.

types.title: Concrete Poem
types.preview: Poetry in which visual arrangement is as important as textual content, forming shapes or patterns with words.

types.title: Elegy
types.preview: A mournful or reflective poem, typically lamenting the dead or meditating on loss and mortality.

types.title: Free Verse
types.preview: Unrhymed poetry without regular meter, emphasizing natural rhythm and expressive freedom.

types.title: Haiku
types.preview: A minimalist three-line Japanese poetic form, traditionally 5-7-5 syllables, evoking nature or fleeting moments.

types.title: Light Verse
types.preview: Humorous or whimsical poetry that plays with language, rhythm, and clever wordplay.

types.title: Limerick
types.preview: A humorous five-line poem with a distinct rhythm (AABBA) and playful tone.

types.title: List Poem
types.preview: A poem constructed through enumeration, cataloging ideas, observations, or images in a rhythmic sequence.

types.title: Lune
types.preview: An American adaptation of the haiku, typically following a 5-3-5 syllabic or word count structure.

types.title: Lyric
types.preview: Emotionally expressive and personal poetry, often musical in tone and reflective of inner feelings.

types.title: Ode
types.preview: A formal and often exalted poem praising a person, idea, or object with deep admiration.

types.title: Quatrain (Ballad Meter)
types.preview: A four-line stanza poem with alternating lines of iambic tetrameter and trimeter, often with rhyme.

types.title: Slam Poetry
types.preview: Performance-based poetry meant to be spoken aloud, often political, raw, and emotionally charged.

types.title: Sonnet
types.preview: A structured 14-line poem, often in iambic pentameter, exploring love, beauty, or philosophy.

types.title: Villanelle
types.preview: A 19-line poem with repeating lines and a fixed rhyme scheme, known for its hypnotic effect and emotional resonance.
